And as you know there are so many methods in Research Methodology and when we think
about empirical research, we often think in terms of questionnaire, interview schedule, survey, etcetera.
But there is a method which is completely different from these techniques.
The method is called as Case Study method.
A ca… a case study method involves the systematic understanding of the information about a person,
event, group, nation, etcetera.
In other words, it is an in-depth study of a person, event, group, nation, etcetera.
And it helps in narrowing down the research from a broad topic to a narrower topic.
It is not just a data collection technique, but a methodology in itself.
A case study uses of number of data collection techniques like oral history, documents, participant
observation, and in-depth interview.
Case study can be focused on an individual or a group or a community or a society.
A single case doesn't have to mean just one single person, it might be a family, a social
group or even a single organization.
A case study can involve dealing with quite a number of individual actually.
For example, a case study may involve interviewing staff in a small but growing computer company
on the social psychological aspect of managing staff.
This information could then be used to compare with other org… larger companies in terms
of how they had tackled staff management issues at a similar stage in their history.
It is important to determine the area of social life or event that needs to be studied.
For example, if you want to study about a family, just interviewing the family members
might not be sufficient as family mim… members might not give the required data.
The researcher then need to talk to the members of the neighborhood to get the required data.
In case studies this becomes important as the interaction with the other members of
the community will also become relevant data for the researcher.
Here each case is treated as a single case.
Researcher like Robert K. Yin defines the case study research method as an empirical
inquiry that investigates a contemporary phenomenon within its real life context.
When the boundaries between phenomenon and context are not clearly evident, and in which
multiple sources of evidence are used.
Researcher have used the case study research method for many years across a variety of discipline.
Social scientists, in particular, have made wide use of this qualitative research method
to examine contemporary real life situation and provide the basis for the application
of the ideas and extent of methods.
Case studies often confused with ethnographic account.
Nilika Mehrotra in the course that she has developed on the field research for IGNOU
differentiated between the two.
She says, “What distinguishes case study from more general ethnographic ro… report
is the details and particularly of the account.
Each case study is description of specific configuration events in which a particular
set of actors have been involved in some defined situation at a particular point of time.
In setting out a case study, the analyst must decide in advance at what point to enter the
ongoing flow of event and at what point to withdraw from it?
It should emphasize on the theoretical connection between the events rather than the events themselves.
Any technique can be used for the collection of data and it is preferably to operate with
Since, data beyond what is strictly germane to this purpose are redundant.
Thus, a case study method is a very important method and it has been used by physician and
psychologists for many years to examine their cases.
This method is also used in business and law curricula to help students to bridge gap between
foundations studies and practice.
There has been a debate on case study method whether it should be used or not.
So, there have been various arguments regarding the use of case study as a method or technique
of data collection.
Some thinkers argue against the use of case study as a method.
According to them a case study method gives a narrow account of the individual, family, situation or event.
The other set of thinkers are in favor of using case study as a method or technique
as it gives a holistic understanding of the individual family, situation or event.
To avoid such an argument a researcher can use case study as a method, adding gender
statistical process to it.
This way he or she can synergise the two perspective and conduct a holistic research of the issue.
For example, a statistical survey might give the information on the quantity of d… of
the data like how much time children spend watching television or internet?
But in the, it is the case study method of the group that will determine why they do so?
Another important thing about the case study is that it might introduce new and unexpected
results during its course and just not prove or disprove hypothesis.
This aspect is important as it leads the researcher  to a new direction and paves way for many new researches.
Moreover, case study might not be that much useful in physical sciences, but for social
sciences, it is very important method of data collection.
The case study method makes research more interesting than a purely statistical research.
Once we have understood the arguments that have taken against and for for the case study,
let's also understand some characteristics of the case study.
The very first characteristic of the case study is, it is narrowly focused.
Mostly a case study offers a description of only a single individual and sometimes about
groups and often the case study focuses on a limited aspect of a person such as the psychological
symptoms or their experience.
Secondly, it combines objective and subjective data.
This is the most important characteristic of case studies, because the researcher may
combine objective and subjective data and all the data regarded as valid data for analyst,
analysis and as a basis for inferences within the case study.
He or she can combine the objective description of behavior and its con… context and details
of the subjective aspects such as feelings, belief, impressions or interpretation.
In fact, case study is uniquely able to offer a means of achieving an in-depth understanding
of the behavior and experience of a single individual.
Thirdly, it is a descriptive study.
The data collected describes the person, group, or family.
The main emphasis always on the construction of verbal description of behavior or experience.
But quantitative data may be collected.
In doing so, a high level of details is provided, it is an in-depth understanding of the behavior
and experience of a single individual.
Finally, it is a process oriented.
The case study method enables the researcher to explore and describe the nature of processes,
which occur over time in contrast to the experimental method which basically provides a still snapshot
of processes, which may be continuing over time, like for example, the development of
language in children over time.
After understanding the characteristics, let's also define the d… various types of case studies.
According to Yin and Winston, there are three types of case studies.
First is exploratory – In exploratory case studies, fieldwork that is data collection
may be undertaken before defining research question.
This type of a study may be seen as a prelude to a larger social scientific study.
Second type of case study is called us explanatory case study.
This type of study seeks to explain certain phenomena and is used when conducting studies
particularly in complex studies of organizations or communities.
The third aspect is called as descriptive case studies.
This type of study requires the investigator to present a descriptive theory, which establish
the overall framework for the investigator to follow throughout the study.
Before beginning research, the investigator must determine exactly what the unit of analysis
in this study will be.
When we are designing study we have to keep few points in mind because it is the most important thing.
It is very easy to conduct a case study, but it is very difficult to design a case study.
So, to design a case study one should keep in mind the subject and the relevance of the subject.
The first step is to isolate the group or person whom you are trying to study.
For example, statistical analysis show that the sex ratio has declined in India.
A case study of one or two states will help the researcher in determining the social and
economic reasons responsible for it.
Secondly, it is important to plan and design the way you are going to address this study
and to ensure that the data collected is relevant.
Researcher has to keep in mind that study is focused and concise.
The researcher should carry a list of points that he or she is going to try and address
during this study.
It will help him or her in ensuring that all research is done around these points.
Finally, it is important for the researcher to be passive during his or her research.
He or she has to act like an observer, then an experimenter as it will give the researcher
more information on the issue.
How do we, once we have designed the case study how do we analyze a case study?
The most interesting part about case study is its analysis as it is more opinion based
then statistical method.
The data is gathered into manageable form and a narrative is constructed.
To make the results more interesting try to use examples in narratives.
While analyzing the statistical data can also be of use but that should not give all the
results as in case study method.
The aim of the researcher is n… only trying to judge trends and not analyze every piece of data.
The analysis should be produced in such a way that a layman also should be able to understand it.
A case study is designed to provoke reason debate, and there is no right or wrong answer
in the case study.
Thus, its analyst, analysis paves way for further research, which is an achievement
for any research and the researcher.
The case study method with its use of multiple data collection method and analysis technique
provides researcher with the opportunity to triangulate data in order to strengthen the
research findings and conclusions.
Susan Soy writes, “Specific techniques include placing information into arrays, creating
mattresses of categories, creating flow charts or other displays, and tabulating frequency of events.
Researchers use the quantitative data that has been collected to corroborate and support
the qualitative data which is most useful for understanding the rationale or theory
underlying relationship.”
Another technique is to use multiple investigator to gain the advantage provided when a variety
of perspective and insights examine the data and the patterns.
When the multiple observation converge, con… confidence in the finding increases.
Conflicted pers… perception on the other hand cause the researcher to pry more deeply.
She further writes, “Another technique, the cross-case search for patterns, keep investigators
from reaching premature conclusion by requiring that investigator look at the data in many different ways.
Cross-case analysis device the data by type across all cases investigated.
One researcher then examine the data of that type thoroughly.
When a pattern from one data type is corroborating by the evidence from another, the finding is stronger.
When evidence conflicts, deeper probing of the difference is necessary to identify the
cause or source of conflict.
In all cases, the researcher treats the evidence fairly to produce analytical conclusions,
answering the origin, how and why research questions?
Now, let's understand the advantages of the case study method.
Searle has talked about the advantages and disadvantages of the case study method.
She has discussed following points as the advantages of the case study method.
One, it stimulates new research.
A case study can sometimes highlight extraordinary behavior, which can stimulate new research.
Some unexpected results from the case study can pave way for the new research.
It contradicts the established theory.
Case Studies may sometimes contradict established theories.
Searle cites the case study of severely deprived Czechoslovak twins, and the remarkable recovery
they showed when placed in a caring social environment as an example of a case study,
which challenged the established theory of the earlier of life being a critical period
for human social development.
Giving new insight into the phenomena or experience.
Case study gives a new insight into phenomena or expedience.
As case studies are so rich in information they can give insight into phenomena which
we could not gain in any other way.
It permits investigation of otherwise inaccessible situations.
Searle claim that the case study gives psychological researchers the possibility to inve… investigate
cases, which could not possibly be engineered in research laboratories.
One example of this is the case of Genie.
This severely deprived child whose case enabled researcher to study the effect of extremely
social deprivation continued from infancy to puberty.
To create such a situation for research purpose would be totally unethical and not possible.
But when Genie was discovered by social workers, the use of case study methodology permitted
much deeper insight into the mechanism, processes and consequences of our experience and recoveries.
We have seen the advantages of the case study methods.
There are several disvantage… disadvantages of the case study method, which are also described
by Searle only.
She identify the number of dis… disadvantages to case study method.
First one is replication is not possible.
A uniqueness of data means that they are valid for only one person, while this is strength
in some forms of research, it is a weakness for others, because it means that findings
cannot be replicated.
And so, some type of reliability measures are very low.
The researchers on subjective feelings may influence the case study that is researcher
is sometimes biased.
Both the collection of the data and the interpretation of they, of them is a subjective analysis by the researcher.
This is particularly true of many of the famous case studies in psychology’s history, especially
the case studies reported by Freud.
In unstructured or clinical case studies, the researchers on interpretation can influence
the way that data are collected, that is, there is a potential for researchers bias.
Third, disadvantage is the memory distortion, the heavy reliance on memory when reconstructing
the case history means that the information about past experience and events may be notoriously
subject to distortion.
Very few people have full documentation of all or various aspects of their life and there
is always a tendency that people focus on factors which they find important themselves,
while they may, may be unaware of other possible influences.
So, keeping all these things they are sometimes very disadvantageous.
And fi… finally, it is very problematic in generalizing.
Serious problem in generalizing the results of a unique individual to other people because
the findings may not be representative of any particular population.
Despite having some disadvantage, the case study method is very useful and is commonly
used in discipline like medicine, psychology, sociology, business and law.
To understand the case study method, let's take an example of a case study method from the field of law.
There is a beautiful example given by Epstein, which has been mentioned in IGNOU notes on Research Methodology.
It goes like this, “While explaining the application of case study method in the field
of law, Epstein treated law as a problem with which all human groups would appear to be
confronted, and for which solution must be devised and showed how the case study method
employed both as a field technique and as a tool of analysis, and applied in different
ways may serve to illuminate these problems.”
The discussion has concentrated on law as a body of rules, as a set of procedure of
enquiry and adjudication, and as an instrument of social control.
Epstein makes a further point about law that it may also be regarded as embodying a system of values.
Moreover, as a social institution, it is, it it is, itself subject to evaluation.
We are concerned here with the basic assumption or postulate that underlying the social life
of a community and the ways in which the task and purpose of law may be perceived.
To conclude, the case study method is an important technique of data collection.
This method provides detailed descriptive data which is usually qualitative in nature.
It is also a complex method as sometime it produces large amount of data, which the researcher
is not able to handle.
Many disciplines use this method to build upon theory, to produce new theory, to dispute
or challenge theory, to explain a situation, to provide a basis, to apply solution to situation,
to explore or to describe an object or phenomena.
Thus, in Susan Soy’s words, “The advantage of the case study method are its applicability
to real life, contemporary human situation, and its public accessibility through written reports.
Case study results relate directly to the individuals everyday experience and facilitate
an understanding of complex real life situation.
It is in fact, a methodology that gives holistic understanding of a case.”

Then is the Comparative Rating Scales - Comparative Rating Scale is very important scale, in the
case of this scale, the position on the rating scales are explicitly defined in terms of
a given population or a group or in terms of people with known categ..., characteristics.
Thus, the rater may be asked to specify the comparative ability of a teacher with reference
to the teaching of a college or he may be asked to specify the comparative skills of
a painter with reference to other paintings example X, Y, or Z.
The comparative ability of the individual or the group in the question may be expressed
in percentage terms by rater.
For instance, Mr. A is more competent than ten percent of the teacher.
The rater must have a clear knowledge of the ability of the given group or individuals.
Precautions and Limitations for Rating Scales - It is difficult and sometime dangerous to
fix up rating about many aspects of an individual or overall aspect of, from only one or two known qualities.
There may be some “halo-effect” in the judgement which should be carefully guarded against.
The raters may overestimate the qualities of a known person and underestimate those
of unknown person.
The rater very often do not want to make extreme judgements.
In the absence of objective standards or definitions different rates, raters may give judgements
on the basis of subjective evaluation.
Thus, this scale becomes unscientific and unreliable.
The raters themselves must be unbiased and trained.
Then the specification of the reference group and the definition of the attributes being
measured must be objective and clear.
In the case of judgements of complex attributes it is better to use less differentiated scale.
Several raters giving independent judgment can work as a team and can be very helpful
in increasing the reliability of ratings, particularly when these are made during the
process of analysis by coders.
However, the rating scales are very simple and useful to apply irrespective of the method
of data collection.
Rank Order Scale - There is another method of scaling called Rank Order Scale.
Rank Order Scale is another method of comparative and relative rating.
In this method, the judge is required to rank individuals in relation to one another.
When the population is very limited, the judge has to prepare a rank order of individual
from higher in the scale to the lowest.
In a rating scale the individual rater himself may be subject of rating.
This is known as self-rating.
Self-rating has its own advantage and limitations.
However, self-rating has been found to be useful in measuring the attitudes like intensity,
importance, liking and so on.
The following two methods may be illustrative.
Paired Comparison - This is a simple method of ranking scale.
In this type of scale two stimuli are presented before the judges out of which the better
one is to be selected.
The continuum is properly defined.
The ranks are different types of jobs, for instance, suitable for ladies can be determined.
The investigators can make several pairs of job available.
The respondents may be asked to point out which of the jobs, two jobs he or she likes.
After all the pairs have been considered any possible inconsistency may be located.
For instance, if job two is preferred to job three and job three is preferred to job four,
then by the transitivity axiom, job two is preferred to job four.
If somebody prefers in this connection job four to job three, his behaviour is inconsistent
and the inconsistent result may be eliminated.
In this method, the number of preferences of all persons for a particular job is added
and is divided by the number of people who are giving the preferences.
The result that is obtained becomes who are giving the preferences.
The result that is obtained becomes the scale value for the particular job.
On this basis, score values are ascertained, the scale value is explained numerically.
This method is only a rough and simple method.
It can, however, be made more meaningful by constructing the paired comparison mat…
matrix, as has been done by Gutlford in his Psychometric Method.
Next is called the Horowitz Method - Horowitz Method applied a ranking scale for testing racial prejudices.
He took eight pictures of Negroes and four pictures of white children.
These twelve pictures were shown to the school children who were asked to indicate their preferences.
First preference was indicated by the number one, second by two, third by three and so on.
Then, separately the scores for the whites and for the Negroes were added and compare.
In this way, it was possible to know the attitude towards Negroes and whites.
Needless to say, the smaller the score the greater is the preference.
If all the white children are given the first four preferences the total score would be
ten is equal to one plus two plus three plus four, but if they are given the last four
preferences the total score would be forty two that is nine plus ten plus one plus twelve.
So, the possible range for the white children would be from ten to forty two.
The probability of score value would be therefore ten plus forty two divided by two is equal
to twenty suc..., six.
If, the actual score is less than twenty six, it would be considered as favourable attitude
and a score more than twenty six would imply an unfavourable attitude.
The same photos can be used for choosing the companions for a variety of situations case by case.
If there are only five situations, the maximum number of white faces in all the five situations
say for going to party, for play, for dancing and so would be five into four is to twenty.
Now, taking twenty as equal to hundred, the percentage of actual number can be calculated.
Since the number of white faces was four out of five, the probability of selection was eighty percent.
Any increase or decrease in the number may be in favour or against the case depending
on the direction of differences.
Picture tests have been used by many investigators to find out the decisive factors governing
the individual preferences and attitudes.
Then, we will, let’s talk about Attitude Scale - An Attitude Scale is a very important
method in qualitative research.
In this type of scale, the attitude of an individual towards the matter, thing, object
or system can be known from the score of his responses given on a questionnaire.
The score will place him on a scale.
He simply expresses his liking or disliking agreement or disagreement with the issue involved
as given in the forms of questions.
On the basis of this reply, he assigned a score which indicates his position.
This type of technique is used in a measuring the social attitude.
In attitude scale, some relevant statements are to be considered by the respondent.
In attitude scale, some relevant statements are to be considered by the respondent.
The statements are formed in such a way that they are intimately related to the attitude
which is sought to be measured.
Indirectly statements may sometimes be used to reveal the attitude.
Secondly, the scale should be able to specify the various, but crucial shades of opinion.
For instance, extreme, moderate and neutral attitude must be expressed through the statement
so that the respondents have several reasonable ways of expressing their attitudes.
Thus, the method of scale formulation remains very decisive and so is the method of scoring.
Des..., depending on the difference in these regards, there may be various types of attitude scale.
Let us discuss them.
First one is the point scale.
In this scale, at first, a crucial number of words about which the opinion is required is selected.
The words maybe dowry, eve-teasing, prostitution, divorce and so on.
The respondent is to cross out every word that is more annoying than the, than pleasing to him.
One point is given to each agreement or disagreement whichever is to be chosen.
If agreement is to be considered, for instance, each word which has not been crossed will
be given one point.
According to this method, the attribute of a respondent is known by calculating the number
of words crossed or not crossed.
The word selected should be suggested of an attitude and the opposite words should be
given at the same time.
There may be another variety of point scale.
In such a scale, two sets of words indicating both favourable and unfavourable opinions are given.
The unfavourable items may be crossed and favourable items may be left. For instance,
if a person scores out of words favouring capitalism and leaves out those favouring
communism, he can be said to be a communist. Thrus…
Thrustone Scale - Thrustone Scale developed in the nineteen twenties in US generates group
of indicators of a given variable, say beauty, etcetera that can be empirically used.
The general procedure for this scaling is that a researcher selects a number of relevant
statements containing a set of caree..., categories agrees or disagrees.
These statements or items are then given a number of judges to order them a continuum
from one to eleven to form the scale.
The items are selected from each of the ordered category giving preference to the items on
whose ranking the judges agreed.
The procedures involved five steps.
First is composing a large number of statements by the researcher concerning the attitudes to be measured.
The statement should cover favourable, unfavourable and neutral items.
Each statement should ex… express only one unambiguous idea and be in a form that perhaps
is it to be endorsed or rejected.
Each statement is written on a separate piece of paper.
Ranking items by a number of judges to order them on a continuum.
The least favourable item is given score one and the most favourable item is given score
four or five and so on.
This is called giving a scale value to statement into a number of categories.
According to how favourable or unfavourable the items are to the attitude being investigated.
Each judges rank each item according to the favourable of the items to the attitude usually
in the eleventh category.
Thus, one item might be ranked in the third category by one judge and in the eleventh
category by another judge.
These items are combined into one master set of eleven categories.
Computing the average scale value median for each item.
This is done by re-grouping the slips by item.
Suppose, a given item had slips on sets of two, six, eight and eleven.
All the slips for the, this item are collected and put aside.
Each item, thus, has a set of slips whose number correspond to the number of judges.
For each item the net tan value is calculated. Selecti…
Selecting the specific scale item that is statements and computing cumulative percentage value.
Testing the relevance of the item that is statements by the researcher and reducing their numbers.
Each statement is identified through scale value.
The judge asked to rank an individual on a scale of eleven, but thirteen, nine and seven
are also used with the middle category ‘neutral’.
Generally, the categories are labelled A through K rather than one through eleven so that the
middle category is ‘F’.
The eleven categories are arranged from A on the left, K on the right, with A representing
the most unfavourable attitude, F neutral and K the most favourable.
Here, it is the judges who rank the individuals say on the scale of ‘beauty’ each judges
places each item on one of the eleven categories to represent his or her judgement or how favourably
or unfavourably it represents the attribute to be scaled.
If the variable authoritarianism, the judges would be asked to assign the scores of one
to the weakest indicator or authoritarianism and the score of eleven to the strongest indicator.
Once all the judges have completed this task, the researcher examines the scores assigned
to each item by all the judges to determine which item produced the greatest agreement
among the judges.
The items on which the judges disagree would be rejected as ambiguous.
In the variable of beauty a respondent who scores seven to eight might be regarded as
more beautiful than who scores five or less.
However, Thurstone Scale is not often used today in research because of the time and
energy required to have ten to fifteen judges scoring the item.
It is also not easy to get judges with the required professional skills and experience
on the given variable.
So, we need Likert Scaling - Likert Scaling is developed in nineteen thirty two and is
used to determine the relative intensity of different items or statements.
In the summr… summated scale or a Likert scale, if answers to questions are to be ascertained
only as agree or disagree, one can be sure that he is measuring the same concept, say,
suitability of a boy as future husband.
But, the problem arises when one cannot be sure that all questions measure the same concept.
Therefore, developed a technique by increasing the variation in the possible scores by coding
from strongly agree to strongly disagree instead of merely agree or disagree.
The advantage in the Likert Scaling is that it eliminates ambiguity in the ordinary of
the responses category.
If the respondents were permitted to give answers like sort of agree, pretty much much
agree, rarely agree, definitely agree, agree very much and so on, the researcher would
find it impossible to judge the relative strength of the agreement intended by the various respondents.
Likert format resolves this problem.
In forming the item pool, three considerations are important.
Since the aim of an item is to spread the respondent over the responses category, no
purpose is served by including such item to which nearly every respondent is likely to
respond in the same way.
Since neutral items do not work well in Likert Scale questions which are likely to be answered
as uncertain or undecided should be avoided.
It is advisable to have roughly equal number of positively and negatively worded items in the scale.
Likert Scale is much simpler than the Thurstone Scale.
Likert Scaling does not rely on judge’s opinion and is widely used in professional literature.
Constructing possible scale items.
The researcher constructs a series of items that express a wider range of attitudes from
extremely positive to extremely negative.
In general, eighty to one twenty items are thought to be sufficient, but four items as
many items are as needed are generally considered.
Each items call for checking one of the five answers.
In terms of strongly agree, agree, undecided, disagree, strongly disagree or it could be
daily, frequently, occasionally, rarely, never.
This is shown in the following example.
First, the retirement age of college or university teachers should be raised to sixty five years,
strongly agree, agree, undecided, disagree, strongly disagree.
Second, old teachers have more knowledge than the young teachers.
Do you strongly agree, agree, undecided, disagree, strongly disagree.
Then, old teachers remain more keen to re… to read new articles and books than the young teachers.
Do you strongly agree, agree or undecided, disagree or strongly disagree.
Teachers remain as physically and mentally fit at sixty five age as at sixty years.
Strongly agree, agree, undecided, disagree, strongly disagree.
So, instead of raising the age of retirement, old teacher should be given fellowship for
undertaking research or writing books.
Strongly agree, agree, undecided, disagree, strongly disagree.
It will not reduce the chances of new persons being employed.
Strongly agree, agree, undecided, disagree, strongly disagree.
So, the questionnaire consist of the above five points with respect to the statements
are administered to the respondents who indicate their responses.
The respondent will imply various scores as shown above.
The scores are consistently arranged either from the higher to the lower or from the lowest
to the highest.
By adding up the different scores of an individual his total score is calculated that is summation
of different scores for different statements.
The researcher should identify the items which have a higher discriminatory power.
The responses are interpreted to determine which of the statements discriminate very
clearly between high score and the low score on the total scale.
It has to be measured that the questionnaire is consistent.
To achieve this, the items with low discriminatory power or those having no significant correlation
with the total score are eliminated.
The main idea to ensure that every item or statement is related with the attitude which is under study.
The Likert-type scale has the following main advantages over the Thrustone scale.
The method of construction of Likert-type scale is less cumbersome.
It is, it supplies more precisely and definite response towards the issue.
The intermediate vague points are absent in the scale.
The Likert scale permits the relevance of several five degree agreement or disagreement,
but Thrustone Scale is based on only two alternative responses that is acceptance or rejection.
Likert-type scale is more informative and reliable than the Thrustone Scale.
In a Likert-type scale any items or statement empirically consistent with the statement
may be included.
Thrustone Scale, only the strictly related items are included.
Thus, Likert-type scale has a border area of reference and has also method of checking
internal consistency which is conspicuous by its absence in Thrustone Scale.
However, the Likert-type scale is not free from defects.
The judgement on the basis of total score which is estimated by calculating the mean
or median is not scientific.
The total score value maybe the same in many cases, but the attitude may be different towards an issue.
The score on the Likert-type scale may be helpful for making an ordering of the people,
but such an ordering will not have any scientific and objective basis.
Another defect of the scale is that there is no objective basis for expressing different
degrees of agreement or disagreement.
However, despite some limitation it remains an important ordinal scale.
Bogardus Scale - Cumulative Scale or Borgardus Scale is the cumulative scale, a respondent
is given a number of questions to express his agreement or disagreement over an issue.
The items are arranged in such a way that a respondent who responds favourably to item
number two, also responds favourably to item number one, and one who replies favourably
to item three also replies favourably to item one and two and so on.
Therefore, the individual who answers favourably have a higher total score than who, those
who answer unfavourably.
The score of an individual is computed by counting the number of items he answered favourably.
His score indicates for him a particular position on the scale.
The interval between the position may not be equal.
The items may be arranged from favourable to unfavourable in a systematic manner or
may be randomly selected.
The cumulative type of scale was successfully used by Borgardus first.
Thus, it is also known as Borgardus Scale.
The main purpose of the social distance scale or Bogardus Scale is to measure the attitude
towards a particular racial group or groups.
A number of suggested relationship may be listed to which members of an ethnic group
may be admitted.
The respondent is to indicate as to which racial group is to be admitted by him for
each of the specified relationship.
The attitude measured by the closeness of relationship that a respondent is willing
to accept or the social distance that he likes to maintain.
The Bogardus-type scale is can be shown.
Relationship I would accept with, marriage, relationship of marriage, or of friendship
or of neighbourhood or of an employment or of citizenship or visited to my country or
exclusion from my country for any of the different ethnicity member.
So, the more, if I am okay with a person of a different ethnicity staying in my country
and then I give a particular score and I am okay that he should only be visitor to my
country, I will give him a different score.
If he is a cit..., I allow him to be a citizen of my country or he can have employment in
my country I don’t mind the person of a different ethnicity being my neighbour or
I don’t mind a person of a different ethnicity being my friend and I don’t mind him marrying
in a different kind of community or ethnicity, then my acceptance level is high.
The more acceptance there is the less is the social distance.
So, the respondent is to circle each of the seven categories to which he is willing to
accept a particular group.
The respondent’s first feeling reaction can be known by this.
For a group, if a respondent circles three, he is also expected to circle four and five
for the same group, where three means that he do, do not mind that a person of a different
ethnicity is his neighbour.
That means he does not mind if he is in pa… part of his country or if he is a visitor to his country.
So, if a respondent does not circle three, he will most probably not circle one and two
that means marriage and friendship, for these indicate even closer relationship.
The seven categories indicate a gradual increasing social distance.
The fact that the specified items in Bogardus Scale form a cumulative scale is empirically
borne out in many countries.
However, some practical reversal may be noticed on a social distance scale.
For instance, a group may not be liked as neighbour, but may be liked as a friend in a club.
But these reversals are more possible in individual cases rather than for the group as a whole.
The reversal have been found in to be mostly due to the influence of the external factors.
In the Bogardus-type scale, the respondent has to indicate his first feeling.
He has to give his resea..., reaction to each race as a group and he should not take into
account any individual member of a group, best or worst, into account.
The social distance can also be calculated mathematically.
In order to do this, weights are attached to different categories of relationship.
Thus, if there are only five categories, the weights such as one, two, three, four, five
can be assigned to the first five categories respectively.
The following procedure is generally adopted for the measurement of social distance.
Place the weight and percentage response for each category in a row.
Multiply the percentage responses by its weights.
Add up the product and this will be the social distance.
In the Bogardus-type scale, the score does not indicate the exact extent extent to or
degree of percentage of a group over the other.
This is, of course, the implicit idea of any ordinal scale as we have stated elsewhere.
One important difficulty in this type of scale is that one may not be fully acquainted with
the group and hence it is not possible for him to state the attitude.
The influence of an individual member or members may not be eliminated from the mind while making preferences.
With the development of the Thrustone and Likert Scale method, attention has been shifted
away from the cumulative scale towards unidimensional scaling which seeks to avoid the influence
of the external factor.
In fact, doubts have been raised by Carter and other reg..., in regard to the continuum
scale as given by Thrustone-type scale.
Different statements, for example, regarding war in a Thrustone-type scale do not fall
along a straight line.
For instance, war is good, war is bad and I do not think about war.
These statement cannot make one continuum or a straight line.
When one is combining different and contradictory statements about an issue, it is impossible
to specify as to what is exactly being measured.
This reaction has given rise to the development of various scaling techniques and the Guttman
scale is one such attempt in this direction.
Guttman method, also called as Scalogram - The Guttman scale is based on the assumption that
the various attitude statements in the scale belong to the same dimension.
The attainment of a high degree of unidimensional is the major concern of the Guttman scale.
However, the Guttman scale belong to the broad category of cumulative scale.
According to Guttman, universe of content can be considered to be unidimensionally only
if yields a perfect, or nearly perfect cumulative scale.
A perfectly cumulative or unidimensional scale is hardly possible in social research.
Scalogram analysis is a simple method of testing the scalability of the statement.
The view of judges are not necessary in this case.
A diagram in which individual responses are laid out is called a Scalogram.
In the Guttman technique, the perfect scale implies that a person who answers a given
question favourably will have a higher total score than a person who answers it unfavourably.
The Guttman scale is analytically complex apart from the fact that there is no guarantee
that the various items will scale and even if they do the universe of the content may
remain narrow in coverage.
This method is more appropriate for scaling ordered behaviour than less structured and
broad-based attitude.
Guttman model is deterministic in nature.
It assumes that a person who response positively or negatively to one item must respond positively
or negatively to a series of others.
The model can be made probabilistic rather than deterministic.
This attempt has been made by “Latent Structure Analyst” as developed by Lazarsfeld.
Guttman has developed another technique.
According to this, the respondent not only give his view, agreement or disagreement,
but he also mentions the intensity or degree which is classified into five categories.
First, for each respondent we must get two scores that is content score and intensity
score which can be plotted against each other on a graph.
The result often gives a U-shaped curve.
The more extreme views have highest intensity.
The content some at the lowest point of the universe may be regarded as the dividing line
between favourable and unfavourable responses.
The lowest point suggesting favourable.
So, this is how he developed another technique which is also very useful in understanding the Guttman scale.
In this section, we have discussed the concept of measurement and scaling and why there is
a need for the these techniques.
We have also discussed type of scales which give us an understanding about when and where
to use this scaling technique so as to get a correct measurement.
Though, scaling is an important technique, but it cannot completely rely on this for
understanding human behaviour.
As human beings are more complex than and are normally exposed to more than one stimuli.
There is no unique way that you can use to select a particular scaling technique for
your research study.
Thank you so much, hope you you have a better understanding of it after this.

Well, we will discuss now about the various type of data sources.

A good researcher, planner starts data collection through accessing secondary sources firstly.
Secondary sources give pre-determined and pre-approved directions to research.

Primary data sources, now we will discuss about it.
Data collection is a tedious task.
Researcher must have clarity about the times of data sources.
Primary sources are also called direct sources of data collection.
Investigator has to formulate questions pertaining to research field before collection primary data sources.
Primary data is collected through various ways- it may be interview, observation, questionnaire,
case study and survey method.
We are going to discuss about them.
Well, primary sources of data collection as you can see in the screen could be interview,
questionnaire, observation and survey.
Well, interview method, now we will discuss about this method.
Interview is face to face interpersonal situation in which one person known as interviewer ask
the person being interviews known as respondent, questions, designs to get answers pertained
to the purpose of research problems.
Well, interview is a method of collection of primary data by investigator from the respondent
personally or through any means of communication.
Interview method may further be categorized into various sub methods.
First is personal interview and telephonic interview.
Well, these are the two categories which we discuss now.
Personal interview, under personal interview investigators collect responses from respondent
by personal contact.
Well, investigator has to formulate a record sheet containing questions pertaining to research.
Personal interview is the most commonly used an authentic method of collection of primary data.
Then, we have telephonic interview method as well.
On the other side, telephonic interview is also used to collect primary data, well, respondent
Telephonic interview method is used where respondent are resident of distinct places.
Generally, the respondents are approached for appointment for interviewer under this method.
Well, this method is used to save time of collection of primary data.
Interview method has a number of advantages in research to collect primary source of data.
Interview is a flexible method of data collection.
It is flexible in asking questions and can be altered as per respondent understanding
of language and words.
It is a direct method and more reliable.
It is more clear and easy to explain.
Rate of response from the respondent is very high as compared to other methods.
Personal and confidential information can only be collected through interview method.
Well, a class of respondents that is children, literates and persons with special ability
and persona… personally disabled are more comfortable to give response through this method.
eliminating personal barriers.
Observation – Well, observation is another method of collection of primary data through
watching, noticing, receiving and recording observational facts of a group of population
or controlled respondent doing some specific nature of activities.
Well, this method is used to record or observe real time responses by noticing activities
or respondent of particular subject field or on the basis of area of study.
Observation method may be scientific observation or social science observation.
Under scientific observation various relational responses of chemical and other substances
are recorded by the researchers.
Under social science observation method habits, natura… nature, daily routine or working
style is of a group of responses are observed and recorded.
Well, observation is a process of acquiring knowledge through the sense of organ that
is directly through the sensory organ like eyes, ears, nose, etcetera.
But it is sometimes more as it involves an element of interference also.
In other word, seeing and looking are purely sensory behavior whereas observation is sensory
behavior plus intellectual participation.
Observ… method, observation method of collection of primary data may be categorized in various
types, structured or unstructured observation, participant and non-participant observation
and controlled and uncontrolled observation.
Structured and unstructured observation – Now, we will discuss about it.
Structured observation method includes already defined parameters and variables which have
to be observed by the investigator during the course of observation.
However, under unstructured observation there are no much fixed variables.
Participant and non-participant observation – A participant observation method involves
active participation of an investigator in the observed group of people.
Well, investigator participates in all professional social routine and religious activity of the
respondent group as active member.
Variables under research problem are observed and noted by investigator with real-time participation
in the activities of a group under observed.
Under non-participation observation method investigator only investigates the group under

Investigator records requisite responses of the group from outside over viewing only under
non-participant method of primary data collection.
Now, we will discuss about the controlled and uncontrolled observation.
Well, controlled observation is another method of collection of primary data.
Under this metho… method a social condition or scientific situations are created for observed
group to find behavior and habitual activities of the respondents.
Under uncontrolled observation natural condition is provided to the respondent to notice their behavior study.
Observation method of primary data collection has various advantages.
Well, it serves a formulated research purpose.
It is a plan systematically method with general propositions.
It is a real-time recording of behavior, habits and responses of respondents under natural
or controlled environment.
Observation method is suitable to collect data of scientific as well social science research.
Questionnaire method – Well, questionnaire method is most common used method of collection
of primary data under research methodology.
Questionnaire is a tool used to collect data from respondent by personal contact or by
sending print questionnaires through post or electronic mail sent to the respondent
through email category.
which the respondent fill himself.
Structured questionnaire with optional responses in a documentary form are circulated among
respondent for getting responses pertaining to the research problem.
Questionnaire contain question related to research problems.
A questionnaire method may be structured questionnaire, non-structured questionnaire, open ended questionnaire,
close ended questionnaire and mixed questionnaire.
Structured questionnaire – Structured questionnaire is a well-planned and prepared in advance
containing definition, concrete and predefined questions.
Questions are arranged in a well-structured manner for correlating question in various sections.
Questions are prefixed and only set of questions asked in a written format are liable to answers by the respondents.
Well, structu… structured questionnaire are used to send by post or through email system.
Now, we will discuss about the non-structured questionnaire.
Well, non-structured questionnaire is used as an introductory questionnaire having skeleton
structure of the questions.
Questions are framed by face to face interviewing method.
Non-structured question is used to collect primary data through face to face interviewing method.
Moreover, most of the questions are framed by investigator during the period or course

Open ended questionnaire – Well, this form of questionnaire in open ended questionnaire
is a questionnaire used in collection of data where respondent is free to write their response in writings.
Responses are recorded at the place given for each question.
Responses are free to give feedback in their own language.
Closed questionnaire – On the other hand, closed ended questionnaires contains question
with multiple options.
Closed ended questionnaire is used to collect answer or responses of audience among the
options already designated by the investigator.
However, respondents have no option to write their own views under these methods.
Mixed questionnaire – Well, mixed questionnaire is a combination of open ended and closed ended questionnaire.
Under this questionnaire, questions are provided with multiple options to choose among along
with option to explain if not available in given option.
Well, questionnaire method has a number of advantages, investigators receives credible
information in written form from respondents.
Respondents are free to opt or write their responses with sufficient time limit.
Questionnaire based responses may be received from remote places through email.
This method is more useful where the research field is very vast.
This is not an expensive method.
The anonymity of respondent is safeguarded under questionnaire method of primary data collection.
Another method is survey method.
Survey is a rich research method of investigating by direct observation of a phenomena or collection
of information through interview, questionnaire, etcetera.
Survey method is used for collection of primary data for social, demogra… demographic opt…
opinions and attitudes pertaining to spec… specific respondents.
The main objectives of survey method are to collect and make available data about social
problems and to describe social phenomena and to study the social conditions and the
relationship between two and more social phenomena or social behavior as it is.
So, survey method is further classified into following types, general and specific survey,
regular and adhoc survey, primary and final survey and census and sample survey.
Now, we’ll discuss about the categories of survey method.
General and specific survey – Well, general survey is the collection information about
an individual human or an organization or an institution with no specific objectives.
The primary purpose of general survey is to collection general information without send…
setting predominated questions and format.
On the other side, specific survey method is referred to collect specific or predetermined
information on the basis of already set questions based on the research problem.
The data rele… relevant to research problem and its solutions only are collected under
specific category of method.
Regular and adhoc survey – It is another form of a survey method.
Regular survey is a method of collection of data supporting research at a regular interval.
Adhoc survey is another method of collection of primary data under which survey is performed
in a specific condition but not regularly.
Preliminary and final survey – Well, preliminary survey is a survey conducted to collect primary
information abou… before starting actual survey with a view to conduct pilot study.
Well, preliminary survey is useful for research design and making necessary changes in it.
of research study with a view of testing of hypothesis and data validation.
Final survey is performed in condition where population response changes at a very fast
rate with a change in time.
It is also played a greater role where testing of hypothesis requires more responses at the
last stage of research study.
Now, we will discuss census and sample survey.
Census is a study of population and is performed at regular interview.
In India, census is recorded through survey method at a regular interview interval of ten years.
Census method of primary data collection under research is performed where investigator set
to collect data among a designated population.
In the case of sample survey, a small portion of the universe that is sample of the entire
community under the study is taken.
It is assumed that this sample is representative of the whole universe and the findings and
the conclusions are attributed to the whole universe.
Sample survey is generally performed to collect primary data pertaining to a large group of
respondents where responses of a small group are collected to represent whole group.
Survey method has a number of advantages.
Survey method is assumed to be advantageous to solve immediate prob… to sol… solve
immediate problem and is reliable due to its quantitative character.
Survey method facilitate scope of future research.
It extend its scope to collect data on social problem and activities.
Primary data sources are collection of data directly through target respondents.
It may involve interviewing, questionnaire based method, survey or observation method.
Researchers or investigators has to approach directly target audience to collection primary
sources of information directly.
It is very tedious and skill oriented work.
Sometimes researchers has to experience the same condition of respondents for collecting information.

Now, viewers, we will discuss about the secondary data.
Secondary sources of data play a vital role in the research study, secondary sources of

Secondary data sources are readymade and recorded during the some authorized agencies or organizations

Secondary sources treated as fast, less expensive, easy assessable source of data collection.

Secondary data is so easy to access.
Well, researchers or investigators has to browse library data centers for finding resource

Secondary data source may be published or unpublished form of records, it maybe government

Secondary data bridges the gap between already established result under the previous researchers

Secondary sources are used by researchers immediately after finalization of research

Secondary sources support designating research plans supporting initiation of research process.
Secondary sources are very useful for guiding researchers to direct the method of research
must be used for completing research under the study.
Well, in this chart you can see that secondary sources contains a number of writ… written records.
Secondary sources of data may be classified as, secondary sources are classified as internal
data source and external data source.
In internal data source, it again further divided into primary documents and external
data source is divided into published records and unpublished record.
In in internal data source, under private documents it could be bibliography, it could
be diaries, could be letters and it could be memories.
And in external data source, it is under published records, it is journals and magazines, it
is newspaper, it is Government documents published, it could be annual report, it could be statistical
abstract, it could be census report, mass communication, commission and committee reports,
these type of information.
Internal sources – Well, internal sources are private document written by various researchers
in the same field.
These are such records which gives written evidence about the process of research in
the similar past researches.
It includes bibliography, biography, diaries, letters and memories.
These resources are generally used in social sciences research.
In some cases private or internal resources are useful in experimental research too.
These are such responses written or recorded by the past researchers during the course
of their past search in similar field.
Now, we will discuss about the external sources.
External sources are such records which found either in published or unpublished format.
These are such written records which are published in journal, magazine, newspaper, annual reports,
or government department reports, statistical reports, census report, mass communication
reports, reports published by commission and committees.
So, published records are available in data centers and libraries for reference purposes.
Researchers or inve… investigators approach indexing tools to find relevant secondary source.

The objective of study must be taken in mind while selecting secondary sources.
Secondary data must be appropriate and must be referred from the identical previous research

Adequacy – Secondary sources of data under consideration must be evaluated before taken

Secondary sources selected must be useful to study part of the researcher of full research study.
